ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Crafting an empirical research question, collecting original survey data, synthesizing insights into a substantial paper
Very specific to my thesis topic

I developed analytic writing and critical thinking skills through developing and discussing my thesis with my advisors. I gained great insight into my chosen topic that I would not have achieved outside of an intensive writing credit.
I learned to design a research topic from scratch, work closely with a professor, and drive my own reading and writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: flexibility with research topics 
Weaknesses: too little guidance, scope of the major made it very difficult to come up with a research question, experience is very advisor-dependent - not enough cohesion within the program
It is what you make of it, and I enjoyed it.
More events for the EP&E community to meet each other would've been nice.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It is good to write a thesis
